intro: Anacampseros, commonly known as the ice plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Aizoaceae. These plants are characterized by their succulent leaves and flowers that often resemble small stars. They are native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, where they have adapted to hot, dry climates. Anacampseros species typically produce small, colorful flowers that bloom in the spring or summer. Their ability to store water in their fleshy leaves allows them to thrive in harsh environments.
